EntryTitle: ACOS GOSAT/TANSO-FTS Level 2 bias-corrected XCO2 and other select fields from the full-physics retrieval aggregated as daily files V9r (ACOS_L2_Lite_FP) at GES DISC
Quality: Biases in ACOS data are still studied. The project recommends using the Lite products.

RelatedUrls.Description: Global amounts of column CO2, averaged for 2010, using ACOS_L2_Lite_FP, from all available for this year "Lite" files, gridded on a 6x6 deg grid, and smoothed for the presentation.
Access the dataset landing page from the GES DISC website.
Access the data via the OPeNDAP protocol.
Use the Earthdata Search to find and retrieve data sets across multiple data centers.

This software (NASA NTR-49044) retrieves a set of atmospheric/surface/instrument parameters from a simultaneous fit to spectra from multiple absorption bands. The software uses an iterative, non-linear retrieval technique (optimal estimation). After the retrieval process has converged, the software performs an error analysis. The products of the software include all quantities needed to understand the information content of the measurement, its uncertainty, and its dependence on interfering atmospheric properties.

Abstract:
Version 9r is the current version of the data set. Older versions will no longer be available and are superseded by Version 9r.
The ACOS Lite files contain bias-corrected XCO2 along with other select fields aggregated as daily files. Orbital granules of the ACOS Level 2 standard product (ACOS_L2S) are used as input. 

The "ACOS" data set contains Carbon Dioxide (CO2) column averaged dry air mole fraction for all soundings for which retrieval was attempted. These are the highest-level products made available by the OCO Project, using TANSO-FTS spectral radiances.

The GOSAT team at JAXA produces GOSAT TANSO-FTS Level 1B (L1B) data products for internal use and for distribution to collaborative partners, such as ESA and NASA. These calibrated products are augmented by the OCO Project with additional geolocation information and further corrections. Thus produced Level 1B products (with calibrated radiances and geolocation) are the input to the "ACOS" Level 2 production process.

UseConstraints.Description: The Earth Observing System Data and Information System (EOSDIS) data use policy for NASA data can be accessed at https://earthdata.nasa.gov/earth-observation-data/data-use-policy.
